field_treatment_procedure_searchable.name: treatment_procedure_searchable
field_treatment_procedure_searchable.label: Make this treatment searchable?
field_treatment_procedure_searchable.instructions: Should this treatment be used to help return results for associated items like providers, locations, etc.?

field_treatment_procedure_alternate.label: Alternate Names for This Treatment or Procedure
field_treatment_procedure_alternate.name: treatment_procedure_alternate
field_treatment_procedure_alternate.instructions:
Insert any other names, phrases or acronyms that this treatment or procedure may be known by. Separate each alternate name into its own item.

These alternate names will be used to help this page appear in search results for those terms.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_additio.name: treatment_procedure_schema_additional_rdf
field_treatment_procedure_schema_additio.label: Specific RDF Class About This Entity
field_treatment_procedure_schema_additio.instructions:
Add a URI-identified RDF class that unambiguously indicates this entity's identity (e.g., https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q729267 for radiation oncology).

This will be used for the additionalType and sameAs Schema.org properties.

For information on the additionalType Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/additionalType.

For information on the sameAs Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/sameAs.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.label: MedicalEntity Subtype
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.name: treatment_procedure_schema_medicalentity
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalEntity.

For information on each subtype, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalEntity#subtypes.

choices.MedicalTest: MedicalTest — Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.
choices.MedicalProcedure: MedicalProcedure — A medical procedure is a process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.name: treatment_procedure_schema_medicaltest
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.label: MedicalTest Subtype
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalTest.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalTest#subtypes.

choices.none: None — Either MedicalTest is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.BloodTest: Blood Test — A medical test performed on a sample of a patient's blood.
choices.ImagingTest: Imaging Test — Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes.
choices.MedicalTestPanel: Medical Test Panel — Any collection of tests commonly ordered together.
choices.PathologyTest: Pathology Test — A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.name: treatment_procedure_schema_medical_procedure
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.label: MedicalProcedure Subtype
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalProcedure.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalProcedure#subtypes.

choices.none: None — Either MedicalProcedure is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.DiagnosticProcedure: Diagnostic Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for diagnostic, as opposed to therapeutic, purposes.
choices.PalliativeProcedure: Palliative Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
choices.PhysicalExam: Physical Exam — A type of physical examination of a patient performed by a physician.
choices.SurgicalProcedure: Surgical Procedure — A medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed for diagnose, or therapeutic purposes.
choices.TherapeuticProcedure: Therapeutic Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for therapeutic purposes, aimed at improving a health condition.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_therape.name: treatment_procedure_schema_therapeuticprocedure
field_treatment_procedure_schema_therape.label: TherapeuticProcedure Subtype
field_treatment_procedure_schema_therape.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of TherapeuticProcedure.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/TherapeuticProcedure#subtypes.

choices.none: None — Either TherapeuticProcedure is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.MedicalTherapy: Medical Therapy — Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g., hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.
choices.PsychologicalTreatment: Psychological Treatment — A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.name: treatment_procedure_schema_medicaltherapy
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.label: MedicalTherapy Subtype
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalTherapy.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalTherapy#subtypes.

choices.none: None — Either MedicalTherapy is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.OccupationalTherapy: Occupational Therapy — A treatment of people with physical, emotional, or social problems, using purposeful activity to help them overcome or learn to deal with their problems.
choices.PalliativeProcedure: Palliative Procedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
choices.PhysicalTherapy: Physical Therapy — A process of progressive physical care and rehabilitation aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.RadiationTherapy: Radiation Therapy — A process of care using radiation aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.RespiratoryTherapy: Respiratory Therapy — The therapy that is concerned with the maintenance or improvement of respiratory function (as in patients with pulmonary disease).

field_treatment_procedure_schema_Medical.name: treatment_procedure_schema_MedicalImagingTechnique
field_treatment_procedure_schema_Medical.label: Imaging Technique Used (MedicalImagingTechnique)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_Medical.instructions:
Select the most appropriate MedicalImagingTechnique.

For information on the imagingTechnique Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/imagingTechnique.

For information on the MedicalImagingTechnique Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalImagingTechnique.

choices.Radiography: Radiography — Radiography is an imaging technique that uses electromagnetic radiation other than visible light, especially X-rays, to view the internal structure of a non-uniformly composed and opaque object such as the human body.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_subtest.label: Component Tests of the Panel (subTest)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_subtest.name: treatment_procedure_schema_subtest
field_treatment_procedure_schema_subtest.instructions: For information on the subTest Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/subTest.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_tissues.name: treatment_procedure_schema_tissuesample
field_treatment_procedure_schema_tissues.label: Tissue Sample Type (tissueSample)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_tissues.instructions:
The type of tissue sample required for the test.

For information on the tissueSample Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/tissueSample.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_usedtod.label: Condition(s) the Test Is Used to Diagnose (usedToDiagnose)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_usedtod.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usedtodiagnose
field_treatment_procedure_schema_usedtod.instructions: For information on the subTest Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/usedToDiagnose.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_usesdev.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usesdevice
field_treatment_procedure_schema_usesdev.label: Device Used (usesDevice)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_usesdev.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/usesDevice.

For information on the MedicalDevice Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalDevice.

sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usesdevice_code
sub_fields.label: Code (code)
sub_fields.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/code.

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usesdevice_code_codingsystem
sub_fields.label: Coding System (codingSystem)
sub_fields.instructions: For information on the codingSystem Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/codingSystem.

sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usesdevice_code_code
sub_fields.label: Individual Device Code (codeValue)
sub_fields.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/code.

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usesdevice_code_name
sub_fields.label: Name Associated With the Device Code (name)

sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_usesdevice_code_url
sub_fields.label: URL of Device Code Description or Detail Page (url)

field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.name: treatment_procedure_schema_medicalproceduretype
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.label: Type of Procedure (procedureType)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_medical.instructions:
Select the most appropriate MedicalProcedureType.

For information on the medicalProcedureType Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/procedureType.

For information on the MedicalProcedureType Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalProcedureType.

choices.NoninvasiveProcedure: NoninvasiveProcedure — A type of medical procedure that involves noninvasive techniques.
choices.PercutaneousProcedure: PercutaneousProcedure — A type of medical procedure that involves percutaneous techniques, where access to organs or tissue is achieved via needle-puncture of the skin. For example, catheter-based procedures like stent delivery.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_drug.label: Drug or Medicine Used (Drug)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_drug.name: treatment_procedure_schema_drug
field_treatment_procedure_schema_drug.instructions:
If relevant, add the drug or medicine used in the medication procedure.

For information on the Drug Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/Drug.

sub_fields.label: Proprietary Name (proprietaryName)
sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_drug_proprietaryname
sub_fields.instructions:
Proprietary name(s) given to the drug, typically by its originator(s) or creator(s). Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/ to find or confirm this information.

For information on the proprietaryName Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/proprietaryName.

sub_fields.label: Generic Name (nonProprietaryName)
sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_drug_nonproprietaryname
sub_fields.instructions:
The generic name(s) of this drug or supplement. Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/ to find or confirm this information.

For information on the nonProprietaryName Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/nonProprietaryName.

sub_fields.label: DrugPrescriptionStatus
sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_drug_drugprescriptionstatus
sub_fields.instructions:
Indicate whether this drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter.

For information on the DrugPrescriptionStatus Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/DrugPrescriptionStatus.

For information on the enumeration members of the DrugPrescriptionStatus Schema.org enumeration type, visit the links at https://schema.org/DrugPrescriptionStatus#subtypes.

sub_fields.label: rxcui
sub_fields.name: treatment_procedure_schema_drug_rxcui
sub_fields.instructions:
The RxCUI drug identifier from RxNorm. Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/.

For information on the rxcui Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/rxcui.

field_treatment_procedure_schema_duplica.label: Duplicate Therapy (duplicateTherapy)
field_treatment_procedure_schema_duplica.name: treatment_procedure_schema_duplicatetherapy
field_treatment_procedure_schema_duplica.instructions:
Select any other therapies that duplicate or overlaps this one.

For information on the duplicateTherapy Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/duplicateTherapy.

field_treatment_procedure_locations.label: Locations for this Treatment or Procedure
field_treatment_procedure_locations.name: treatment_procedure_locations

field_treatment_procedure_physicians.label: Providers performing or prescribing this treatment or procedure
field_treatment_procedure_physicians.name: treatment_procedure_physicians
field_treatment_procedure_physicians.instructions: The providers will display in alphabetical order. If there is more than one row of providers, the first row will display before prompting the user to load more.

field_treatment_procedure_clinical_resou.label: Clinical Resources
field_treatment_procedure_clinical_resou.name: treatment_procedure_clinical_resources
field_treatment_procedure_clinical_resou.instructions: Resources will be displayed on the page in the order in which they were published, with the most recently published resources showing first.

field_medline_code_type.label: Code Type for Medline Plus
field_medline_code_type.name: medline_code_type
field_medline_code_type.instructions: Pick which code type to choose

field_medline_code_id.label: Medline Code ID #
field_medline_code_id.name: medline_code_id
field_medline_code_id.instructions: Find Codes: ICD-10 | NDC | LONIC

field_medline_view_data.label: Medline Data Verification
field_medline_view_data.message: View Medline Data

field_treatment_procedure_embed_codes.name: treatment_procedure_embed_codes
field_treatment_procedure_embed_codes.label: Embed / Syndication Code
field_treatment_procedure_embed_codes.instructions: Example: Syndication Code from HHS Syndication Storefront

field_treatment_procedure_youtube_link.name: treatment_procedure_youtube_link
field_treatment_procedure_youtube_link.label: Featured Video
field_treatment_procedure_youtube_link.instructions: Select a video from the UAMS YouTube or Vimeo accounts that features this treatment or procedure and that supports the content of this page. Include the full URL, including https://

field_treatment_procedure_short_desc.name: treatment_procedure_short_desc
field_treatment_procedure_short_desc.label: Short Description
field_treatment_procedure_short_desc.instructions:
This will be the description included for this page when it appears in search results.

Write a short description that generally informs and interests users with a short, relevant summary of what this page is about. Think of it like a pitch that convinces the user that this page is exactly what they're looking for.

The text will be limited to 160 characters. The preferred length is at least 110 characters.

field_treatment_procedure_cta.label: Call-to-Action (CTA) Bar(s)
field_treatment_procedure_cta.name: treatment_procedure_cta
field_treatment_procedure_cta.instructions: Define up to two CTA Bar blocks

sub_fields.label: Action Type
sub_fields.name: cta_bar_action_type
sub_fields.instructions: Only choose None if your action is contained within your body text.

sub_fields.label: URL Action
sub_fields.instructions: All fields must be populated or your link will not display.

sub_fields.label: Button Link Description
sub_fields.name: cta_bar_button_description
sub_fields.instructions: This is needed for accessibility. It helps differentiate between multiple links that use the same text like "Learn more". Describe the intent of the link, like "Learn more about the ABC Department".

sub_fields.label: Phone Action
sub_fields.instructions: All fields must be populated or your telephone number will not display.

sub_fields.label: Text before phone number
sub_fields.name: cta_bar_phone_prepend
sub_fields.instructions: This, combined with the phone number will generate a short action phrase. Keep this text very short. Do not include the phone number here. Examples: "Call", "Fax Referrals to".

sub_fields.label: Phone Number
sub_fields.name: cta_bar_phone
sub_fields.instructions: Format your phone number using dashes. Include the area code. Example: 999-999-9999

field_treatment_procedure_podcast_name.name: treatment_procedure_podcast_name
field_treatment_procedure_podcast_name.label: UAMS Health Talk Podcast Topic Name
field_treatment_procedure_podcast_name.instructions: Include a single topic name as listed in the "Topics" dropdown of the embedded player on https://uamshealth.com/podcast/.
